intro: Herpestis semiserrata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf false mallow, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, including China, India, and Southeast Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. The plant features slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with slightly serrated edges. Its flowers are small, clustered in loose inflorescences, and are usually pale pink to white in color. Herpestis semiserrata is valued in traditional medicine for its purported medicinal properties.
